subject: AI & Agents
title: LLM-as-Judge: Models Evaluating Models
description: A micro-lesson that makes LLM-as-Judge: Models Evaluating Models usable.

hook.text: What if GPT-4 grades your smaller model's answers? That's LLM-as-judge.

buildup.text: A strong model scores a weaker model's output on criteria you define in a prompt.

discovery.text: It's cheaper than human eval and correlates well for structured tasks.

twist.text: LLM judges have biases: they prefer longer answers, formal tone, and their own outputs.

climax.text: Calibrate: compare LLM scores to human scores on 50+ examples before trusting them.

punchline.text: Useful shortcut, not a replacement for humans.

quiz.question: What is a known bias of LLM-as-judge?
